column4: but it probably just does something lame like "oh can't swapoff, not enough memory" :P
what if there's not enough room?
/ Fudge, not sure what happens if your swapoff without enough memory, kernel may start killing processes with out-of-memory errors
yeah, heh, except usually I see high swap on production servers where letting the kernel murder my poor innocent applicatiosn would be Bad (tm)
I have a low mem Ubox here booting it now, I want to see if it crashes...
let me know what happens ;)  5$ says kernel murders processes at random
the test box is just plain jane 10.04 with no toys installed.
issuing sudo swapoff -a, top shows 6.8MB MEM free, 27MB in swap...
holy manhole covers Batman, they went into the sewers...It's still running, 0 swap !!
yeah, from your swapoff there, out of memory errors or anything?
it's taking a looooong time to load Nautilus :)
It looks like the system automatically "niced" a lot of the running processes, and I noticed the "cached" readout increase significantly. Reading the top manpage about it now...
